description: This action initiates the engagement process from an existing opportunity by accepting the engagement invitation and creating a corresponding opportunity in the partner's system. Similar to StartEngagementByAcceptingInvitationTask, this action is asynchronous and performs multiple steps before completion.

parameters.name: AwsSubmission
parameters.description: Indicates the level of AWS involvement in the opportunity. This field helps track AWS participation throughout the engagement, such as providing technical support, deal assistance, and sales support. Specifies the type of AWS involvement in the opportunity, such as coselling, deal support, or technical consultation. This helps categorize the nature of AWS participation. Visibility (string) --- Determines who can view AWS involvement in the opportunity. Typically, this field is set to Full for most cases, but it may be restricted based on special program requirements or confidentiality needs.

nested_params.name: InvolvementType
nested_params.description: Specifies the type of AWS involvement in the opportunity, such as coselling, deal support, or technical consultation. This helps categorize the nature of AWS participation.

nested_params.name: Visibility
nested_params.description: Determines who can view AWS involvement in the opportunity. Typically, this field is set to Full for most cases, but it may be restricted based on special program requirements or confidentiality needs.

parameters.name: Catalog
parameters.description: Specifies the catalog in which the engagement is tracked. Acceptable values include AWS for production and Sandbox for testing environments.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique token provided by the client to help ensure the idempotency of the request. It helps prevent the same task from being performed multiple times. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the opportunity from which the engagement task is to be initiated. This helps ensure that the task is applied to the correct opportunity.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A map of the key-value pairs of the tag or tags to assign. (dict) --- The key-value pair assigned to a specified resource. The key in the tag. The value in the tag.

nested_items.name: EngagementId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the newly created Engagement. Only populated if TaskStatus is COMPLETE.

nested_items.name: EngagementInvitationId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the new Engagement invitation. Only populated if TaskStatus is COMPLETE.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: If the task fails, this field contains a detailed message describing the failure and possible recovery steps.

nested_items.name: OpportunityId
nested_items.description: Returns the original opportunity identifier passed in the request, which is the unique identifier for the opportunity created in the partner's system.

nested_items.name: ReasonCode
nested_items.description: Indicates the reason for task failure using an enumerated code.

nested_items.name: ResourceSnapshotJobId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the resource snapshot job created to add the opportunity resource snapshot to the Engagement. Only populated if TaskStatus is COMPLETE.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The timestamp indicating when the task was initiated. The format follows RFC 3339 section 5.6.

nested_items.name: TaskArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task, used for tracking and managing the task within AWS.

nested_items.name: TaskId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the task, used to track the task's progress. This value follows a specific pattern: ^oit-[0-9a-z]{13}$.

nested_items.name: TaskStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates the current status of the task. Valid values include IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETE, and FAILED.
